content.body: Has there ever been discussion of adding _very common_ functions to the standard. In particular `noop` and `identity`? Is a palatable to propose adding something like `Function.noop` and `Function.identity` to the standard, so people stop creating `() => {}` and `x => x` over and over in their libraries and codebases?
content.formatted_body: Has there ever been discussion of adding very common functions to the standard. In particular noop and identity? Is a palatable to propose adding something like Function.noop and Function.identity to the standard, so people stop creating () => {} and x => x over and over in their libraries and codebases?

content.body: i tried doing that early in my tc39 time, and before i even got to proposal stage nobody found it valuable. engines seem pretty good at optimizing `() => {}`
content.formatted_body: i tried doing that early in my tc39 time, and before i even got to proposal stage nobody found it valuable. engines seem pretty good at optimizing () => {}
